examples.model_answer: Mycenaens (Mycaenean) to Classical Greece 20th century BC-8th Century BCE. This period includes Greek history before Alexander the Great's conquests, when Athens reached its peak as a cultural center under Pericles. It ended with the rise of Macedonian power under Philip II and his son Alexander the Great around 336–323 BCE. The word classical derives from this era; it was later adopted by scholars across Europe who were inspired by Ancient Roman culture during the Renaissance.

However, this difference between one day and two mean that we have to add an extra second every so often...called “Daylight Savings Time” which adds another hour on Sunday at 02:00 local time....this happens once per year! This can make calculating dates for things like anniversaries confusing..so don't forget about it next time you need your birthday reminder emailed out :p
